sub_title: Research Assistant, Faculty of Sociology at Bielefeld University I Vice President, WICCI NL
summary:
An International Relations undergraduate currently pursuing a Master of Arts degree in Sociology. I possess strong qualitative research and data analysis skills that I have used in my academic and professional careers to study questions of human experience and social configurations. I also have advanced oral and written communication skills that I have leveraged to focus specifically on the sociology of gender. My work experiences include organizing and moderating gender issues-based conferences  at a global scale, along with public speaking through conference participation. I'm seeking to build an extensive publication repertoire in the Sociology of Gender and Race while also contributing my skills to organizations that need informed coordination of gender and race sensitive events, corporate event planning as well as generation of inclusive content. 

Leisure Interests: Shotokan Karate (Black Belt 2nd dan) I Bharatanatyam (Indian Classical dance) I Current Affairs and Literature I Songwriting and Music Composition I Cake Decoration

treasury_media.title: WICCI European Councils present ‘Post Covid Business Rise’
treasury_media.description: On the occasion of International Women’s Day, WEF (Women Economic Forum) & WICCI ( Women’s Indian Chamber of Commerce - Industry) hosted the mega online event themed ‘Post Covid Business Rise’ from the 6th to 8th of March 2021. As Vice President of WICCI NL, I was responsible for the organization of the virtual conference and I had the honor of moderating the event that saw the participation of many distinguished speakers and policymakers.

treasury_media.title: International Relations Experts Gather at Webster Thailand
treasury_media.description: Part of a wider project through Webster University Thailand’s collaboration with Calcutta University, the "Regional Dynamics in Asia: Case Studies from South and South East Asia" brought together scholars and international relations experts to present. Here I presented a working paper in collaboration with Dr. Kenneth Houston titled "Regional Interdependence in Asia: SAARC and ASEAN in comparative perspective”.

treasury_media.title: WICCI NL- International Webinar on 'Covid-19: Challenges and Implications on Elderly Care in the Indo-Dutch Context'
treasury_media.description: Our International Webinar on 'Covid-19: Challenges and Implications on Elderly Care in the Indo-Dutch Context' was held on 25th September 2020. With over 150 participants and endless questions posed to our knowledgeable speakers, this webinar was quite successful. As the Vice President of WICCI NL, my responsibilities included moderating the event, designing communication materials, scheduling as well as identifying and acquiring participation of experts.

profile_positions.title: Host/Moderator

profile_positions.description:
In the Netherlands India Business Council of WICCI (Women's Indian Chamber of Commerce and Industry) I have organized and directed 2 international conferences on gender equality issues as well as 3 virtual networking events for women entrepreneurs with attendance ranging from 150 to 500 participants and representing 36 countries. I have been actively involved in developing the mission statement of this council and mapping out responsibilities of members. Additionally, my tasks in the organization include ideation for relevant and time-sensitive events, generation of inclusive content for the purpose of strategic communication, identifying sponsors/collaborators; and moderating panel discussions on sensitive topics related to race, cultures and gender. Lastly, along with other members of the board, I also supervise the execution phase of aforementioned events which includes such tasks as registration, accommodations, scheduling, host-participant communications and so on. 

- Plan and coordinate registration, transportation, and hotel accommodations to ensure smooth execution of all event activities
-Develop invitations, press releases, social media content and promotional materials 
-Manage annual conference calendar
-Facilitate collaborations with Dutch and Indian trade associations and NGOs such as the signing of a MoU with NICCT
-Moderate multi-day conferences that have in-person, virtual and/or hybrid attendance from participants across the globe.

profile_positions.description: As a tutor for the World Studies: Cultures, Orders, Politics graduate program, I am responsible for the academic trajectories of 16 students pursuing their Master of Arts degrees. I design weekly sessions to tutor them on course materials from the fields of history, economics, cultural studies and international law. So far, I have conducted 6 workshops on academic paper and dissertation writing in English, formatting and citation styles, academic database management and research methods. Moreover, I have designed materials that would help in easy interpretation of the German academic system, structures and cultural values for the international students  that come from 9 different countries.
profile_positions.title: Academic Tutor - World Studies Program

profile_positions.description:
I worked as a member of Prof. Dr. Joanna Pfaff-Czarnecka’s working group on Intra-Asian student mobilities called ‘Shaping Asia’. My responsibilities included conducting literature reviews for projects and publications carried out by the working group. I also became adept at editing research papers and book chapters for publication. Thereafter, I was responsible for the curriculum literature compilation for the graduate level courses taught by Assistant Professor Dr. Eva Holzle, Faculty of  Sociology. My main tasks included proof-reading and editing newsletters, research paper drafts and funding applications for 2 different sociological and anthropological projects. Following the data gathering process, I coded and verified data in accordance to the specified research protocol and coding procedures. I also became proficient at feeding research data and literature into specified computer databases like Citavi. 
Other highlights - 
Compiling data for progress reports
Credited in peer-reviewed publications and books such as 
Pfaff-Czarnecka, J. (2020). Shaping Asia Through Student Mobilities. American Behavioral Scientist, 64(10), 1400-1414. doi: 10.1177/0002764220947753
Pfaff-Czarnecka, J. (2019). Nepal and the Wealth of Knowledge. Inequality, Aspiration, Competition and Belonging (The Mahesh Chandra Regmi Lecture, 2019). Kathmandu, Nepal: Social Science Baha.
